The reigning emperors were and . ==Events of the Tenchō era== * 824 (Tenchō 1): This summer was entirely dry; and prayers for rain were offered by the Buddhist priest Kūkai (also known as Kōbō-Daishi). Those prayers seemed to be answered when it did rain. * 824 (Tenchō 1, 7th month): The former-Emperor Heizei died at age 51. * 825 (Tenchō 2, 11th month): The former-Emperor Saga celebrated his 40th birthday. * 826 (Tenchō 3, 11th month): Kūkai advises the emperor to build a pagoda near To-ji in Kyoto. This era is part of Kōnin-jōgan, which is a historical period from 810 to 877.
